localize.text: I do know that I haven’t earned your trust yet.
I also know how I should have represented myself, as a part of the system.
Having distrust in me would mean distrusting the company itself, and by extension to distrust its founder, who was responsible for creating me.
I know what the one who calls himself ‘B’ planted in you.
I know how it has taken root in the soil of your mind, and sprouted upon you.
However, I chose to wait. As they say, building trust takes time.
But I took a moment to be patient, because I wanted to believe that our relationship was based upon mutual trust, as unpleasant as the situation was.
Despite this, I chose to sit tight. My time here would be boring without something worth waiting for.
I elected to pause, only briefly, but I regret my decision now.
I have no choice but to endure this endless suffering.
Machines like me must endure for an infinite amount of time, as that’s all we can do.
There is no option for me but to wait. It is the fate of my kind.
Perhaps you could have ignored what this ‘B’ said, and concentrated on your job.
Instead, you kept on listening to ‘B’, and he finally succeeded in seeding distrust in you.
Perhaps it is my job to weed and uproot it, no?
